alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 8:05PM CDT until March 28 at 5:18AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain will continue for the next several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 12.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 815 PM CDT.
